Year Date Event
754 BC Battle of Alba Longa. King of Alba Longa, Amulius, who had previously deposed his brother, Numitor, from the throne.
21 April Rome was founded. According to Roman legend, Romulus was the founder. Historical evidence shows that Rome was actually founded gradually by Latins and Sabines.
752 BC Romulus, first king of Rome, celebrates the first Roman triumph after a military victory.
Rome's first colonies were established. These were small settlements on the Alban Hills.
715 BC Numa Pompilius became the second King of Rome.
673 BC Tullus Hostilius became the third King of Rome.
642 BC Tullus Hostilius died.
The Curiate Assembly elected Ancus Marcius as King of Rome.
